lessons.title: DeFi Fundamentals
lessons.description: Learn the core concepts of Decentralized Finance and how it's revolutionizing traditional banking

questions.question: What does DeFi stand for?
questions.explanation: DeFi stands for Decentralized Finance - financial services built on blockchain without traditional intermediaries like banks.

questions.question: What is a DEX in DeFi?
questions.explanation: A DEX (Decentralized Exchange) allows users to trade cryptocurrencies directly with each other without a centralized authority.

questions.question: What is yield farming in DeFi?
questions.explanation: Yield farming involves providing liquidity to DeFi protocols in exchange for rewards, typically in the form of tokens.

questions.question: What is a smart contract?
questions.explanation: Smart contracts are self-executing programs on blockchain that automatically enforce agreements without intermediaries.

lessons.title: NFT Essentials
lessons.description: Understand Non-Fungible Tokens, digital ownership, and the creator economy

questions.question: What makes an NFT non-fungible?
options: It's unique and cannot be replaced
questions.explanation: Non-fungible means each NFT is unique and cannot be replaced or exchanged on a one-to-one basis with another NFT.

questions.question: Where is NFT data typically stored?
options: Metadata on blockchain, media on IPFS
questions.explanation: NFT metadata is stored on blockchain, but the actual media (images, videos) is typically stored on IPFS or other decentralized storage.

questions.question: What is minting an NFT?
options: Creating and recording an NFT on blockchain
questions.explanation: Minting is the process of creating and recording a new NFT on the blockchain, establishing its unique digital identity.

questions.question: What is a common NFT standard on Ethereum?
questions.explanation: Both ERC-721 (unique tokens) and ERC-1155 (semi-fungible tokens) are popular NFT standards on Ethereum.

questions.question: What are royalties in NFTs?
questions.explanation: NFT royalties are automatic payments made to original creators each time their NFT is resold on secondary markets.

lessons.title: Web3 Security Basics
lessons.description: Essential security practices for safely navigating the Web3 ecosystem

questions.question: What is a seed phrase?
questions.explanation: A seed phrase is a series of 12-24 words that can restore access to your cryptocurrency wallet if lost or damaged.

questions.question: What should you do before interacting with a smart contract?
options: Verify the contract address and audit reports
Just proceed if it looks legitimate
questions.explanation: Always verify smart contract addresses and check for audit reports before interacting to avoid malicious contracts.

questions.question: What is a common Web3 phishing attack?
questions.explanation: Fake wallet connection requests are common in Web3, tricking users into connecting to malicious dApps or signing harmful transactions.

questions.question: How should you store large amounts of cryptocurrency?
questions.explanation: Hardware wallets (cold storage) are the safest way to store large amounts of cryptocurrency as they're offline and harder to hack.

questions.question: What does 'approval' mean in Web3 transactions?
options: Giving a smart contract permission to spend your tokens
questions.explanation: Token approval gives smart contracts permission to spend specific amounts of your tokens. Always check approval limits carefully.
